text: New speaker of the House Mike Johnson once wrote in support of the criminalization of gay sex  —  Speaker of the House Mike Johnson has a history of harsh anti-gay language from his time as an attorney for a socially conservative legal group in the mid-2000s.

How Mike Johnson's main strength will become his biggest liability  —  Everyone agrees that the Louisianan's anonymity helped him get the speakership.  It won't help him with the long list of other congressional crises.  —  Mike Johnson's anonymity in Washington was a driving force …

The Terrifying Learning Curve Facing Mike Johnson  —  What a neophyte speaker needs to know right now.  —  “It was perhaps Mike Johnson's short tenure in the House that allowed him to win the gavel.  But now he faces a terrifyingly steep learning curve and almost no margin for error,” writes Brendan Buck.

House elects Mike Johnson as speaker after three weeks at an impasse  —  Republicans elected Rep. Mike Johnson (R-LA) to serve as the 56th speaker of the House after three weeks of the lower chamber sitting at a standstill and unable to complete any legislative business.
